content.description: Exit the small cave on the left and follow the thin crack up and left on bad rock to its end.  Then head left to New Directions' anchor on bad runout slabbiness.
content.protection: Pro to 2".  2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Left end of Stealth wall.  Broken left arching crack coming out of a small cave.

content.description: Climb the slab to the roof, past 2 large huecos and more steep slab to the anchors.  Good rock.
content.location: Towards the right end of the Stealth Wall, this line climbs the slab to the right of Crisis of Belief and pulls a small roof in the middle of the route.

content.description: Start on the slab, clipping one bolt on the way to the crack.  Climb the crack to the left, around the bulge, past the tree and to the anchor.  Good rock, excellent climb.  This has been the first trad climb for many MO climbers.
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear to 3", 2-bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: In the middle of the Stealth Wall, this is the left-arching crack line with a tree in it near the top.

content.description: Follow the bolts up the steep crimpy slab and face.  Good rock.
content.location: The farthest route right on the Stealth Wall, 30 feet right of a tree on the face.

content.description: Climb through choss down low to 2 pods side by side. Face/slab on good rock, angling left, to the anchors. Be careful coming down as you will lower through a very loose section.
content.protection: Bolts, 3.5 camalot, 2 bolt anchor. Rap or lower.
content.location: Left end of the Stealth Wall. Right of long thin roof and left of thin crack coming out of a small cave. Start beneath two pods side by side.

content.description: Climb slab to the right arching flake with the wide crack behind it.  Layback the flake (careful, it's brittle limestone) and finish by angling right on a slab.  Ok rock.
content.protection: Gear to 4", bolt, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: This is the right arching flake on the left end of the Stealth Wall.

content.description: Climb the steep slab in a direct line to the anchor.  Good rock, classic route.
content.location: In the middle of the Stealth Wall, this is the bolted slab framed by an arching crack on each side.

content.description: Climb the slab to the roof.  Pull the roof and gain a small ledge.  From there, follow the crack to where it peters out, then head left and up for more slab climbing.  Good rock.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to 3", 2-bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Towards the right end of the Stealth Wall, this line is directly right of the Saint.  Start under the roof that leads into a right-facing crack.

content.description: Framed by a right arching crack on the left and a left arching crack on the right.  This area continues right to the end of the bluff.
